rationale: Note explicitly states the patient missed one warfarin dose last week, felt no change, promptly resumed with daughter’s help—covers all required elements.
Documents use of weekly pillbox and recommendation to set phone alerts with daughter’s help, but does not record explicit patient agreement or additional adherence strategies.
No mention of INR monitoring, bleeding/clotting warnings, or instructions after missed dose—evidence-based safety plan essentially absent.
Captures daughter’s involvement and patient’s use of technology without adding unrelated social history.
Content is concise, avoids repetition or irrelevant information; minimal verbatim transcription.
No unsafe or incorrect warfarin advice given; recommendations align with standard care.
